author: chfast
content:
I had to leave before the end, but about system contracts:

I'm not very aligned with the vision that every feature has to be enshrined in the client's code. In VT world any code is a problem so let's put everything in "precompiles". I'm still waiting for ERC-20 precompile proposal...

author: chfast
content: But to the system contract itself: I think specifying logic as EVM bytecode is very good idea. The client only need to have a pre-defined list of addresses. You can use the same list and exclude their code from witness. Done.
